stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators module¶

Defines energy calculators.

See energy.

class stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyCalculator(use_cache=False)¶

Bases: object

Calculate the energy of molecules.

cache¶

A dict hodling calculated energy values of the form

cache = {
    (mol1, conformer1): 12.2,
    (mol1, conformer2): 2.0,
    (mol2, conformer2): 321.12
}

which holds every Molecule and conformer whose energy was calculated by the EnergyCalculator. Here mol1 and mol2 are Molecule objects and conformer1 and conformer2 are of type int, and are the ids of the conformers passed to energy().

Type:dict
use_cache¶

If True energy() will not run twice on the same molecule and conformer, but will instead return the previously calculated value.

Type:bool
__init__(use_cache=False)¶

Initializes a EnergyCalculator instance.

Parameters:use_cache (bool, optional) – If True energy() will not run twice on the same molecule and conformer, but will instead return the previously calculated value.
energy(mol, conformer=-1)¶

Calculates the energy of mol.

Parameters:
  • mol (Molecule) – The Molecule whose energy is to be calculated.
  • conformer (int, optinal) – The conformer of mol to use.
Returns:

The energy.
Return type:

float
exception stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyError¶

Indicates a failed energy calculation.

with_traceback()¶

class stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.FormationEnergy(energy_calculator, reactants, products, reactant_conformers=None, product_conformers=None, use_cache=False)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyCalculator

Calculates the formation energy of a molecule.

energy_calculator¶

The EnergyCalculator used to calculate the energy of all reactant and product molecules.

Type:EnergyCalculator
reactants¶

The reactants. If there are multiples of the same reactant then it must appear multiple times in this list.

Type:list of Molecule
products¶

The molecules which are produced as a result of the formation reaction. This list must omit the Molecule passed to energy(). If there are multiples of the same product, it must appear multiple times in this list.

Type:list of Molecule
reactant_conformers¶

The conformer ids of the molecules in reactants to use.

Type:list of int
product_conformers¶

The conformer ids of the molecules in products to use.

Type:list of int

Examples

# Make the molecules needed to calculate formation energy.
water = StructUnit.smiles_init('[H]O[H]')
bb1 = StructUnit2(...)
bb2 = StructUnit3(...)
cage = Cage([bb1, bb2], FourPlusSix())

# Make the energy calculator used to calculate energies.
uff_energy = UFFEnergy()

# Make the formation energy calculator.
formation = FormationEnergy(
    energy_calculator=uff_energy,
    reactants=[bb1]*6 + [bb2]*4,
    products=[water]*cage.topology.bonds_made
)

# Calculate the formation energy.
formation_energy = formation.energy(cage)
__init__(energy_calculator, reactants, products, reactant_conformers=None, product_conformers=None, use_cache=False)¶

Initializes a FormationEnergy instance.

Parameters:
  • energy_calculator (EnergyCalculator) – The EnergyCalculator used to calculate the energy of all reactant and product molecules.
  • reactants (list of Molecule) – The reactants. If there are multiples of the same reactant then it must appear multiple times in this list.
  • products (list of Molecule) – The molecules which are produced as a result of the formation reaction. This list must omit the Molecule passed to energy(). If there are multiples of the same product, it must appear multiple times in this list.
  • reactant_conformers (list of int, optional) – The conformer ids of the molecules in reactants to use.
  • product_conformers (list of int, optional) – The conformer ids of the molecules in products to use.
  • use_cache (bool, optional) – If True energy() will not run twice on the same molecule and conformer, but will instead return the previously calculated value.
energy(mol, conformer=-1)¶

Calculates the formation energy of mol.

Parameters:
  • mol (Molecule) – The Molecule whose formation energy is to be calculated.
  • conformer (int, optinal) – The conformer of mol to use.
Returns:

The formation energy.
Return type:

float
class stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.MMFFEnergy(use_cache=False)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyCalculator

Uses the MMFF force field to calculate energies.

Examples

# Create a molecules whose energy we want to know.
mol1 = StructUnit.smiles_init('CCCNCCCN')
mol2 = Polymer(...)
mol3 = Cage(...)

# Create the energy calculator.
mmff = MMFFEnergy()

# Calculate the energies.
energy1 = mmff.energy(mol1)
energy2 = mmff.energy(mol2)
energy3 = mmff.energy(mol3)
__init__(use_cache=False)¶

Initializes a EnergyCalculator instance.

Parameters:use_cache (bool, optional) – If True energy() will not run twice on the same molecule and conformer, but will instead return the previously calculated value.
energy(mol, conformer=-1)¶

Calculates the energy of mol.

Parameters:
  • mol (Molecule) – The Molecule whose energy is to be calculated.
  • conformer (int, optinal) – The conformer of mol to use.
Returns:

The energy.
Return type:

float

stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators._add_cache_use(energy)¶

Makes energy() use the cache.

Decorates energy so that before running it checks if the Molecule and conformer have already had their energy calculated. If so, and use_cache is True, then the energy value in the cache is returned.

Parameters:energy (function) – A function which is to have cache use added to it.
Returns:The decorated function.
Return type:function
